channel.title: About on Kennedy Casey
channel.description: Recent content in About on Kennedy Casey

item.title: About
item.description: About Me Lab Manager, Chatter Lab Department of Comparative Human Development, University of Chicago I currently work with Dr. Marisa Casillas at the University of Chicago as the manager for the Chatter Lab. Previously, I completed my BA in Psychology at Princeton University, where I worked with Dr. Casey Lew-Williams as a thesis student in the Princeton Baby Lab. I study early language learning. My research focuses on how young children extract meaningful information from complex, everyday communicative contexts and explores which cues (linguistic, environmental, social, etc.

item.title: Papers
item.description: Papers Selected Preprints Casey, K., Potter, C. E., Lew-Williams, C., & Wojcik, E. H. (under review). Moving beyond “nouns in the lab”: Using naturalistic data to understand why infants’ first words include uh-oh and hi. preprint data bibtex Journal Articles Baek, S., Marques, S., Casey, K., Testerman, M., McGill, F., & Emberson, L. (provisionally accepted). Attrition rate in infant fNIRS research: A meta-analysis. Infancy. preprint bibtex Casey, K., Novick, K., & Lourenco, S.
